item.title: Pumpkin Macaroni Cheese
item.description:
Pumpkin Macaroni Cheese

Uses a boatload of pumpkin with a boatload of nicely caramlised cheese.

Ingredients

  • 2 1⁄2 cups pumpkin (500g) chopped
  • 2 tablespoons oil
  • 1 teaspoon salt
  • 1 teaspoon pepper
  • 1 teaspoon dried sage

Sauce

  • 40g butter
  • 40g flour
  • 2 1⁄2 cups milk
  • 1⁄4 tsp nutmeg
  • 1 teaspoon garlic powder
  • 1 teaspoon pepper
  • 200g cheddar cheese
  • 25g parmesan cheese
  • 250g macaroni pasta, cooked and drained

Topping

  • 50g cheddar cheese
  • 50g mozzarella cheese
  • 25g parmesan cheese

Method

Preheat the oven to 190°C.

Chop up the pumpkin into chunks and place on a baking tray. Drizzle over the oil, salt, pepper, and ground sage, and coat evenly with your hands. Roast in the oven for 20 minutes. Once cooked leave to cool slightly and blend 1⁄3 of the pumpkin, set aside.

For the sauce, in a large ovenproof pan, melt the butter over a medium-low heat. Gradually mix in the flour to create a roux. Add the milk in 4-5 parts stirring well in between. Continue to stir and cook the sauce for a further 5-10 minutes or until the sauce is simmering and thickened. Stir in the ground nutmeg, garlic powder, pepper, cheddar, and Parmesan. Stir in the blended pumpkin. Stir in the remaining whole pumpkin and macaroni, mix until combined. Top with the cheddar, mozzarella, and Parmesan.

Grill for 10 minutes at 200°C (400°F) until the cheese is brown and bubbling.

item.title: Bircher Oats
item.description:
Bircher Oats

Very nice to eat but also a pain to make.

Ingredients

  • 25g oats
  • 1 tbsp dried fruit
  • 6 tbsp apple juice
  • Berries
  • Splash of milk
  • Handful of almonds
  • Spoon of yoghurt

Method

Soak oats and dried fruit in apple juice overnight. Add the rest of the ingredients in the morning and hope your coffee has kicked in.

item.title: Spinach puff pastry with Fetta and Ricotta
item.description:
Spinach puff pastry with Fetta and Ricotta

Good to burn up some extra pastry.

Ingredients

  • 4 sheets puff pastry
  • 2 1/2 cups frozen spinach
  • 1/2 onion
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 1 tbsp olive oil
  • 1 cup ricotta
  • 1 cup fetta (crumbled)
  • sesame seeds (undisclosed amount)
  • 1 egg

Method

Fry chopped onion and garlic until soft and translucent. Add frozen spinach and cook until no liquid remains. Leave to cool.

Combine with feta and ricotta. Cut each sheet of pastry intro 3 strips. Spread mixture between strips and fold over to make a roll. Brush with egg wash. Cut holes to vent steam. Add sesame seeds to top.

Bake at 180C for 18-22 minutes.

item.title: Red lentil and Chorizo Soup
item.description:
Red lentil and Chorizo Soup

One of my favourites.

Ingredients

  • 1 tbsp oil
  • 1 large onion
  • 200g cooking chorizo
  • 2 carrots
  • Pinch cumin seeds
  • 3 cloves garlic
  • 1 tsp paprika
  • Pinch caster sugar
  • Splash red wine vinegar
  • 250g red lentils
  • 2x400g tin tomatoes
  • 850ml chicken stock
  • Plain Yoghurt

Method

Peel and dice chorizo, Chop carrots. Heat oil in pan. Add chorizo and cook until crisp. Remove with slotted spoon. Add onion, carrot and cumin, and cook for 10 minutes. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add paprika and sugar, cook for 1 minute. Add vinegar . Stir in lentils, add tomatoes and stock. Simmer for 30 minutes. Add back in chorizo and stir in yoghurt to taste.

item.title: Keto Broccoli Salad
item.description:
Keto Broccoli Salad

Bacony, and mayonaissey. If you’re crazy enough to be on Keto this might take your mind off of it.

Ingredients

  • 2 heads broccoli
  • 1/2 cup cheese
  • 1/4 red onion
  • 3 slices bacon
  • 2 tbsp chives
  • 1/4 cup toasted sliced almonds

Dressing

  • 2/3 cup mayonaisse
  • 3 tbsp apple cider vinegar
  • 1 tbsp Dijon mustard

Method

Boil broccoli florets in salt water for 1-2 minutes. Combine dressing ingredients and season.

Grill or fry bacon until crispy and crumble/chop. Mix everyhing in a bowl and toss to combine.

item.title: Fish Soup
item.description:
Fish Soup

Never actually made it

Ingredients

  • 2 onions
  • 2 potatoes
  • 1 carrot
  • Fresh dill
  • Fish heads and/or tails
  • Salt
  • Papper

Method

Put fish in pot. Add water. Add an onion, crossed, and half of the carrot. Boil for 30 minutes. Chop potato, remaining onion and other half of the carrot. Pour mixture through sieve. Add potato and chopped onion, and carrot. Separate fish from bones. Put back in and bring to the boil. Add salt and pepper. Once vegetables are cooked, add dill. Turn off heat, cover and let stand for 15 minutes.

item.title: Spring Goddess Sandwich
item.description:
Spring Goddess Sandwich

It’s a sandwich with greens and a lot of egg based condiments.

Ingredients

  • 1 can chickpeas
  • 1/4 cup parsley
  • 1/4 cup dill
  • 2 tbsp wholegrain mustard
  • 2 tbsp mayonaisse
  • Lettuce leaves
  • Cucumber
  • Thinly sliced carrot
  • Thinly sliced raddish
  • Thinly sliced avocado
  • Alfafa sprouts

Method

Mix together chickepas, parsley, dill, mustard and mayonaisse. Put everything on a sandwich.

item.title: Chickpea Salad
item.description:
Chickpea Salad

A tasty summer salad with chickpeas.

Ingredients

  • 1 can chickpeas
  • 1/2 red onion, thinly sliced
  • 1/2 cucumber, chopped
  • 1 red capsicum, roasted
  • 3 tomatoes, chopped
  • 2 tbsp parlsey
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 3 tbsp lemon juice
  • 2 tsp oil
  • 1/4 tsp salt

Method

Combine: chickpeas, red onion, cucumber, red capsicum, tomatoes, parsley and crushed garlic in a bowl.

Dressing: Combine lemon juice, oil and salt. Whip until emulsified.

Pour dressing over salad ingredients.

item.title: Stuffed Capsicum
item.description:
Stuffed Capsicum

Another good one. Don’t take the capcisums out of the pan when they’ve finished cooking, let them cool down.

Ingredients

  • 8 capsicums (less if they won’t fit in your pot)
  • 500g beef mince
  • 200g rice
  • 150g tomato paste
  • 200g carrots
  • 200g onions
  • salt
  • pepper
  • vegetable oil
  • sour cream

Method

Grate carrots and finely chop onion. Fry in pan in oil. Mix mince and boiled rice in a bowl. Add half of the carrot and onion mix, season with salt and pepper. Cool, and stuff inside hollowed capsicums.

Put other half of carrot and onion mix into a pot. Add tomato paste, add capsicums. Add water to 2/3 of capsicum height. Cover and boil for 45 minutes.

Serve with sour cream.

item.title: Macaroons
item.description:
Macaroons

The french classic.

Ingredients

  • 100g almond meal
  • 180g icing sugar
  • 100g egg whites
  • 1/4 tsp cream of tartar
  • 35g castor sugar

Method

Separate egg whites 24h before - store in a lightly covered bowl.

Beat egg whites and cream of tartar on medium speed until foamy. Add castor sugar. Beat until stiff peaks. In three additions, sift the ground almonds and sugar into the meringue. Fold the mixture until it is of lava consistency. Pipe onto trays and tap to remove air bubbles.

Leave to sit for 30m. Bake at 16 degrees for 15m.

The macaroon should lift freely from the parchment. Fill with cream of choice.

Store in refrigerator

item.title: Dressed Herring
item.description:
Dressed Herring

A Russian favourite.

Ingredients

  • 1 packet Herring
  • 2 potatoes
  • 1 beetroot
  • 1 carrot
  • 1 onion
  • 4 eggs
  • Vinegar
  • Mayonnaise

Method

Unknown.

item.title: Bacon-wrapped cauliflower
item.description:
Bacon-wrapped cauliflower

Yet another Keto meal to try and distract you from the fact you’re on a Keto diet.

Ingredients

  • 1/4 cup oil
  • 1/4 cup lemon juice
  • 1 cauliflower
  • 2 eggs, beaten
  • 4 spring onions
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • 3/4 cup shredded cheese
  • 125g cream cheese
  • 1/2 cup breadcrumbs
  • 1/4 cup parmesan cheese
  • 500g bacon
  • 250g frozen chopped spinach.

Method

Boil 8 cups of water, oil, lemon juice and tbsp of salt in a large pot. Add cauliflower, weigh down with plate. Boil for 12 minutes and let cool.

Combine spinach, eggs, spring onions, crushed garlic, cheese, cream cheese, breadcrumbs and parmesan. Put in piping bag. Turn cauliflower upside down and pipe filling (get the muscles out). Turn cauliflower back over and wrap in bacon. You may need to hold in place with toothpicks.

Roast for 30 minutes at 230C.

item.title: Breaded Lamb Chops
item.description:
Breaded Lamb Chops

A simple extension for an Aussie favourite

Ingredients

  • 2 tsp Dijon mustard
  • 2 tsp honey
  • 2 cloves garlic, crushed
  • 1 tbsp rosemary
  • 3 tbsp olive oil
  • 8 lamb loin chops
  • 100g breadcrumbs

Method

Mix together mustard, honey, garlic, rosemary and 2tbsp of oil. Brush mixture over chops, then coat in breadcrumbs.

Grill or fry chops until tender.

item.title: Cauliflower Salad
item.description:
Cauliflower Salad

Pomegrante and Cauliflower make a surprisingly tasty combination.

Ingredients

  • 1 tsp cumin seeds
  • 1 tsp coriander seeds
  • 1 cauliflower
  • 2 tsp chopped garlic
  • 1 tsp salt
  • Pepper
  • 3 tbsp olive oil
  • 3 spring onions
  • 1 handful coriander leaves
  • 1 handful mint leaves
  • 1 pomegranate
  • 1 tbsp sunflower seeds
  • 1 tbsp pumpkin seeds
  • 1 tbsp toasted seasame seeds

Dressing

  • 3 tbsp lemon juice
  • 3 tbsp tahini
  • 1 clove garlic
  • 1 tsp honey
  • 130g Greek yoghurt

Method

Finely slice spring onion.

Toast cumin and coriander seeds for 1-2 minutes. Cut up cauliflower into small florets. Toss florets in a bowl with garlic, cumin and coriander seeds, salt, pepper and olive oil. Roast cauliflower on a baking tray for 20 minutes at 180C until lightly golden but still crunchy.

Whisk all dressing ingredients together and season. Toss the cauliflower and spring onions in the dressing. Add sunflower seeds, pumpkin seeds, sesame seeds, and pomegranate.

item.title: Baked cod with herd crust
item.description:
Baked cod with herd crust

Very nice but can dry out the fish.

Ingredients

  • 3 tbsp vegetable oil
  • 125g breadcrumbs
  • 1 lime
  • 4 tbsp parsley
  • 2 tbsp chives
  • 1 tsp Dijon mustard
  • 1 tbsp ginger
  • Papper
  • 4 fillters firm white fish

Method

Mix together breadcrumbs, lime zest, chopped parsley and chives, mustard, ginger, oil and seasoning. Place the cod fillets onto a lined baking tray and sprinkle with lime juice. Divide the topping among the fillets, pressing firmly into the fish.

Bake for 20 minutes at 200C.

item.title: Skewer Marinade
item.description:
Skewer Marinade

Good for the BBQ, although they do shrink a bit.

Ingredients

  • 1 cup vegetable oil
  • 1/4 cup dijon mustard
  • 3/4 cup soy sauce
  • 1 1/2 tsp pepper
  • 1/2 cup lemon juice
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 500g diced beef
  • 2 onions
  • 2 capcisums
  • 1/4 cup Worcestershire sauce

Method

Mix all ingredients except beef, onion and capsicum in bowl and mix. Add meat, cover and marinate for 4 to 24 hours.

Add alternating pieces of onion, capsicum and meat on a pre-soaked skewer. Pan fry or BBQ.

item.title: Pumpkin and Pancetta Macaroni Cheese
item.description:
Pumpkin and Pancetta Macaroni Cheese

I don’t even remember making this if I’m honest.

Ingredients

  • 300g dried macaroni
  • 50g butter
  • 6 slices pancetta
  • 1/4 tsp ground nutmeg
  • 1/4 cup plain flour
  • 2 cups milk
  • 1/12 cups grated tasty cheese
  • 600g butternut

Method

Cook macaroni in a large saucepan for 12 mins. Drain.

Peel and grate pumpkin. Melt 10g butter in a pan and add pancetta and nutmeg. Cook for 2-3 mins or until crisp. Remove for pan and put on a paper towel. Melt remaining butter in pan. Ad flour and cook stirringfor 1min. gradually add milk, stirring until smooth. Cook stirring until mixture boils and thickens. Stir in cheese and pumpkin.

Chop pancetta into small pieces and add to pumpkin mixture. Add macaroni and season with salt and pepper. Pour into a greased casserole dish. Bake at 200C for 20-25 mins.

Stand for 5 mins before serving.

item.title: Pea and Ham Soup
item.description:
Pea and Ham Soup

Easy to make and pretty good for winter.

Ingredients

  • 1 cup dried split peas
  • 4 cups water
  • 1/2 onion
  • 1 celery stalk
  • Pepper
  • 1 ham hock
  • 1 carrot

Method

Cook peas, onion, celery, pepper and ham for 1.5 hours in pot of water. Take out ham bone and cut off the ham. Add carrot and cook for another 30 minutes.

item.title: French Onion Soup
item.description:
French Onion Soup

Very tasty, but you do have to find the right cheese.

Ingredients

  • 3 tbsp olive oil
  • 2 tbsp plain flour
  • 1 cup white whine
  • 1L beef stock
  • Bread
  • 80g butter
  • 1 tbsp Dijon mustard
  • 90g gruyere cheese
  • 1kg onions
  • 1 tbsp brown sugar

Method

Halve and slice onions. Heat butter and olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Cover and cook, stirring occasionally for 10 minutes or until onion is beginning to soften. Reduce heat to medium low. Cook, uncovered, for 20 minutes or until onion is very soft. Add sugar. Cook while stirring for 5 minutes until sugar dissolves and coats onion. Add flour and cook or 1 minute. Gradually stir in wine. Simmer for 3 to 4 minutes or until wine reduces by half and mixture is thick. Add stock. Cover, bring to simmer and cook on medium heat for 5 minutes or until soup has thickened slightly.

Toast one side of bread. Butter th e reverse side and add a small amount of mustard and grated cheese. Grill for 1 to 2 minutes or until cheese is melted.

item.title: Zoodle Alfredo with Bacon
item.description:
Zoodle Alfredo with Bacon

Can also be done with normal pasta, but is Keto friendly with the zoodles.

Ingredients

  • 250g bacon
  • 1 1/2 cup heavy cream
  • 1 shallot
  • 1/2 cup parmesan
  • 1/4 cup white wine
  • Zucchini, spiralised
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • Chicken breast (optional)

Method

Finely chop shallot. Cut chicken into pieces and fry in oil. Remove.

Cook bacon for 8 minutes, or until crispy. Drain on paper towel. Keep 2 tbsp of bacon fat. Fry shallots for 2 minutes, and add garlic for 1 minute. Add wine, cook until reduced by half. Add cream and bring to boil. Reduce heat to low and add parmesan. Cook for 2 minutes or until thickened. Add chicken and noodles and toss.
